title: Global basketball shoe sales 2012 - 2013 , by NBA player
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Quarters on X-axis for 2 groups 2012, and 2013. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars.
Over the 5 Quarters, the Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars for both 2012 and Quarter have decreased.
Out of all 2 groups, 2013 had the highest Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars in Quarter Michael Jordan and 2012 had the lowest Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars in Quarter Kevin Durant.
In Quarter Michael Jordan, 2012 had the maximum Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars and it saw the lowest in Quarter Kevin Durant out of all 5 Quarters.
yAxis: Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars

mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Quarters on X-axis for 2 groups 2012, and 2013. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars.
Over the 5 Quarters, the Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars for both 2012 and Quarter have decreased.
Out of all 2 groups, 2013 had the highest Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars in Quarter Michael Jordan and 2012 had the lowest Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars in Quarter Kevin Durant.

max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars on the Y-axis for 5 different Quarters for 2 groups 2012, and 2013 that are presented on the X-axis.
All through the Quarters, similar trend was observed for 2012 and Quarter. In both cases, the Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars have decreased.
In Quarter Michael Jordan, 2013 had the highest Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars 2500.0 among the 2 groups and in Kevin Durant, 2012 had the lowest Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars 35.0.
In Quarter Michael Jordan, 2012 had the highest Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars among all 5 Quarters and it has the lowest Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars in Quarter Kevin Durant.
Quarter Michael Jordan and Kevin Durant had the biggest gap of 1965.0 between the highest and lowest Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars found for 2012.

Among the groups, 2012 had the biggest difference in Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars. Where the maximum Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars was 57.14 times larger than the minimum Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars.
Averaging all 2 groups 2012, and 2013, the Quarter Michael Jordan is the maximum Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars and Derrick Rose is the minimum Shoe sales in million U.S. dollars.
